algorithm_technique: Sort piles, greedily take from largest two until one pile is exhausted or sum of two smaller equals largest.
problem_summary_simple: Maximize score by taking stones from two different piles, stopping when fewer than two piles remain.
problem_summary_technical: Maximize score by pairing stones from two piles. The optimal strategy involves balancing the largest pile with the sum of the other two.
key_insights: The problem can be solved by considering the sum of the two smaller piles versus the largest pile.
If the sum of the two smaller piles is less than or equal to the largest pile, the maximum score is the sum of the two smaller piles.
If the sum of the two smaller piles is greater than the largest pile, the maximum score is half the total number of stones.
